original_solution_mapping.L1: 3000 new bees are born every day. In 7 days there will be 3000*7=<<3000*7=21000>>21000 new bees
original_solution_mapping.L2: If each day the queen loses 900 bees, in 7 days there will be 900*7=<<900*7=6300>>6300 fewer bees
original_solution_mapping.L3: If at the beginning the queen had 12500 bees, then at the end of 7 days she will have 12500+21000-6300=<<12500+21000-6300=27200>>27200 bees
original_solution_mapping.L4: The total number of bees in the hive including the queen is 27200+1 =<<27200+1=27201>>27201

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 6286.
    Returns: the total number of bees in the hive including the queen at the end of 7 days.
    """
    # L1
    bees_born_per_day = 3000 # 3000 bees hatch from the queen's eggs every day
    num_days = 7 # at the end of 7 days
    total_new_bees = bees_born_per_day * num_days

    # L2
    bees_lost_per_day = 900 # loses 900 bees every day
    total_lost_bees = bees_lost_per_day * num_days

    # L3
    initial_bees = 12500 # at the beginning the queen had 12500 bees
    bees_after_7_days = initial_bees + total_new_bees - total_lost_bees

    # L4
    queen_count = 1 # WK
    final_total_bees = bees_after_7_days + queen_count

    # FA
    answer = final_total_bees
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: 3000 new bees are born every day. In {num_days} days there will be {bees_born_per_day}*{num_days}=<<{bees_born_per_day}*{num_days}={total_new_bees}>>{total_new_bees} new bees
If each day the queen loses {bees_lost_per_day} bees, in {num_days} days there will be {bees_lost_per_day}*{num_days}=<<{bees_lost_per_day}*{num_days}={total_lost_bees}>>{total_lost_bees} fewer bees

If at the beginning the queen had {initial_bees} bees, then at the end of {num_days} days she will have {initial_bees}+{total_new_bees}-{total_lost_bees}=<<{initial_bees}+{total_new_bees}-{total_lost_bees}={bees_after_7_days}>>{bees_after_7_days} bees
The total number of bees in the hive including the queen is {bees_after_7_days}+{queen_count} =<<{bees_after_7_days}+{queen_count}={final_total_bees}>>{final_total_bees}

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L1: 3000 new bees are born every day. In 7 days there will be 3000*7=<<3000*7=21000>>21000 new bees
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L2: If each day the queen loses 7 bees, in 7 days there will be 7*7=<<7*7=49>>49 fewer bees
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L3: If at the beginning the queen had 12500 bees, then at the end of 7 days she will have 12500+21000-49=<<12500+21000-49=33451>>33451 bees
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L4: The total number of bees in the hive including the queen is 33451+1 =<<33451+1=33452>>33452

explanation: Input misrepresentation. The value for 'num_days' (7) was used instead of 'bees_lost_per_day' (900).
